comment: Also took 4010, pretty cool professor in the CPE curriculum. Very transparent and organized when it comes to course delivery and assignments. Just do the labs and project and you'll come out fine. His tests are also open note which is very helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: He is a very knowledgeable professor and he is good at explaining different topics for the class. The powerpoints he posts in D2L aren't super helpful outside of class so its best to go to class and take notes. Other than that, the homework and exams are all based off things he covers in lecture. He goes over the labs in class and gives examples.

Professor Lee was mainly responsible for the lab portion of this course. He was always willing to help without giving the whole answer, so you still felt like you learned something. He made an online discord server for us to ask questions outside of lab times and even let us come in his labs for other courses for help. 10/10 would take again!

Professor Lee knows his material and was easy to learn from. He'll guide you when you're stuck but never spoon feed you the answer. He wants you to figure it out yourself. The lab course was easy to follow along and it is encouraged to start your labs early. If you have any questions, send him a message and he'll get back to you almost right away.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He knows his stuff but I wouldn't recommend him if your not an EE major. His expectations for students is clear but I felt his expectations were incredibly high and he is super pre-req heavy. He would be a good choice for circuits 1 but not so much for other courses.Take him at your own risk, he requires lots of studying which could hinder your GPA

I would highly recommend NOT to take Professor Lee at all during your EE curriculum. Complete smart-a** who expects you to have mastered everything before you take his class. Very inconsiderate of each students learning ability, doesn't explain things very clearly, and is there for only a paycheck.

Prof Lee was good for engineering electronics. His lectures are very concise and often spends time working out problems. Easy to follow along. Was always helpful in labs. Very smart and sometimes uses big words/explains things in a sophisticated manner. Overall enjoyed his class

Dr. Lee is a fantastic professor. If you want to be good at electronics, he is your man. If you want an easy A, he isn't. His classes are difficult, but he tries his best to make everything as clear as possible, always has review classes, posts lecture notes, and is available outside of class. Exams, homework, and lab reports are graded.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Lee is one of the worst professors I have ever taken at KSU. He expects you to have mastered anything/everything before his class, circuits 1 and dvq. Unless you have a deep knowledge about all the pre-reqs to this class do not take him. His lectures also jump around he will never show you completely how to solve a problem.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: If you don't have Circuits 1 memorized, don't his class for Circuits 2. "Asks what time it is and tell you how to build a watch" is pretty much how asking any question in the class goes. Never graded anything on time. Only positive is that resources were available to help.

Limited resources in this class. Mathtutordvd will be your best friend. He gives you enough. Your grade is is solely dependent on how well you study. The way this course is graded makes it things a lot less stressful come time for finals. Lenient grader for labs but dont fall behind. He speeds through and makes things look east but MUST STUDY.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Honestly one one the best professors I've had at KSU. For electronics, he gave the basics of whatever topic one class. Then the following classes, it's just examples of that topic. He's pretty straightforward and lenient when it comes to grading. This class is not by any means easy, you would have to go home and study/practice to grasp the topics.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: For all ME majors: if you want to be stressed out by problems that EE majors cant even solve, then by all means take this professor. Be ready to be surprised by test questions that were never covered during lecture or given as homework. It seems like his life goal is to make class as difficult, stressful, and complicated as possible. Have fun.

He is a good professor to take for Engineering Electronics. Look at the old exams he gives out but the problems will usually not be similar to the problems on the practice exams. He sometimes allows points back if everyone did bad on the exam. It is hard to fail his class but also hard to make an A in his class. study for his exams to get A.

He is very easy to understand and is clear about what you should know. There are 3 exams and a final as well as some homework and lab. Homework is graded on whether you wrote something down or not and lab reports aren't bad. Exams are kind of tough but he gives you previous exams and you get a cheat sheet per exam. Very difficult to fail is class.

Professor Lee is by far one of the worst professors at this school.  He goes over material in class like you already know it.  He is not very clear in what he expects of you on tests and puts material on tests that were never covered in class.  Avoid at all costs!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Great professor, teaches the concepts very well. Where it gets difficult is the tests he gives. For engineering electronics the test was mostly circuit analysis that we were supposed to learn in previous class. Problems are always tricky. The only good thing is that he does give you a chance to get some points back provided that you KNOW material.

Dr. Lee creates tests full of material we have never seen in HW or in class. He teaches very fast and the class itself is rather difficult.   Take someone else for electronics if you can. This guy is tough!!
His teaching style is frustrating at best.

Professor Lee is a very good professor to take for engineering electronics. Make sure that you submit the lab report with all the details and you will get an A on the Labs only submit one file for the labs. Also, he teaches in a clear to understand way and makes the subject of Engineering Electronics interesting an engages the class in the subject,
Pay attention. Helpful. Don't expect an easy A.
Avoid at all costs take someone else for Engineering Electronics.
